3.61. 
Fault of both spouses 
1. The spouse against whom an action for divorce is brought may object to his or her own fault and may plead facts proving that the divorce was caused by the fault of the plaintiff. 
2. The court may, having regard to the circumstances of the case, declare that the marriage was dissolved through the fault of both spouses. 
3. A declaration that the marriage is dissolved through the fault of both spouses has the same consequences as a divorce by common consent (Articles 3.51 to 3.544 of the present Code).
